revised_title: Revisiting Transition State Theory for Ion-Molecule Reactions
tldr: This article discusses the application of transition state theory to exothermic ion-molecule reactions, focusing on the modification of the standard formula for the rate coefficient. The author explains how the theory can be applied to bimolecular reactions, termolecular association, and radiative association, and provides a detailed analysis of the partition function and collision frequency factors in these reactions.
